BiblioData.Title: Quantum Semiconductor Device and Method for Fabricating the Same
BiblioData.Abstract: A Quantum semiconductor device comprising: a plurality of quantum dots formed over a semiconductor substrate; a first semiconductor layer formed, burying the said plurality of quantum dots; a plurality of semiconductor dots formed on the first semiconductor layer in respective positions above each quantum dot of the said plurality of quantum dots; a plurality of dot-shaped oxides formed of partially oxidized semiconductor dots; a second semiconductor layer formed, busying the said plurality of semiconductor dots; and a plurality of electrodes formed in respective concavities formed in a surface of the second semiconductor layer in respective positions above each dot-shaped oxide of the said plurality of dot-shaped oxides.

Claims.P: a plurality of quantum dots formed over a semiconductor substrate;
a first semiconductor layer formed, burying the said plurality of quantum dots;
a plurality of semiconductor dots formed on the first semiconductor layer in respective positions above each quantum dot of the said plurality of quantum dots;
a plurality of dot-shaped oxides formed of partially oxidized semiconductor dots;
a second semiconductor layer formed, burying the said plurality of semiconductor dots; and

a plurality of electrodes formed in respective concavities formed in a surface of the second semiconductor layer in respective positions above each dot-shaped oxide of the said plurality of dot-shaped oxides.
2. A quantum semiconductor device according to claim 1, further comprising
an interconnection formed in a trench formed in the surface of the second semiconductor layer and electrically connected to one of the electrodes.
3. A method for fabricating a quantum semiconductor device comprising the steps of:
forming a quantum dot on a semiconductor substrate;
forming a first semiconductor layer, burying the quantum dot;
forming a semiconductor dot on the first semiconductor layer in a position above the quantum dot;
oxidizing a part of the semiconductor dot to form a dot-shaped oxide of the partially oxidized semiconductor dot;
forming a second semiconductor layer, burying the dot-shaped oxide and the semiconductor dot with a concavity formed in a surface in a position above the dot-shaped oxide, and
forming an electrode in the concavity formed in the surface of the second semiconductor layer;wherein in the step of forming the electrode, the electrode is formed by droplet epitaxy method.
4. A method for fabricating a quantum semiconductor device according to claim 3, wherein

in the step of forming the dot-shaped oxide, a part of the semiconductor dot is oxidized by approaching a probe-shaped conductor to the semiconductor dot and applying a voltage between the semiconductor substrate and the probe-shaped conductor.
